wikipedia_page.main: William Douglas (2 July 1863 – 24 September 1943) was a Welsh rugby union back who played club rugby for Canton RFC ,  Cardiff and international rugby for Wales. Douglas was also a rugby referee, and officiated over four international matches.

response: *Billy Douglas (musician) (1912–1978), American jazz trumpeter and vocalist
*Billy Douglas (One Life to Live), fictional character on the television series One Life to Live
*Billy Douglas (rugby union) (1863–1943), Welsh rugby union player
*Billy Douglas (politician), unionist activist from Northern Ireland

Canton Rugby Football Club commenced playing in 1876 and was one of the three clubs that founded the Cardiff and District Rugby Union. During this time three teams played within the Canton boundary. Today only Canton remain, the teams of the 1880s provided Cardiff Rugby Club with a stream of players including Welsh Internationals, William James 'Billy' Jenkins, William James Wood 'Buller' Stadden, Albert John Hybart and Billy Douglas to name a few.
